    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    AbstractRobot
    Abstract class defining the main methods for a generic Robot.
    AbstractRobotPart
    Abstract class that implements the RobotPart interface.
    Actuator
    Interface defining the main methods for a generic Actuator part, i.e., the attack coefficient.
    Arm
    A concrete implementation of a RobotPart; more specifically an Actuator.
    BattleManager
    BattleManager is a Runnable task responsible for conducting a single robot battle.
    Bench
    Interface for a Bench.
    Blaster
    A concrete implementation of a RobotPart; more specifically an Actuator.
    Camera
    A concrete implementation of a RobotPart; more specifically a Sensor.
    Chassis
    A concrete implementation of a RobotPart; more specifically a Frame.
    CombatPair
    A simple class to store the pair of robots selected for combat.
    CycloBot
    A concrete implementation of a Robot.
    Frame
    This class implements RobotPart, but is abstract.
    HumanoidRobot
    A concrete implementation of a Robot.
    Leg
    A concrete implementation of a RobotPart; more specifically a Motor part (a Leg).
    Mechanic
    Mechanic is a Runnable task responsible for repairing a single robot from the repair line.
    Motor
    Interface defining the main methods for a generic Motor part, i.e., the power.
    MyBench
    MyBench is an implementation of the Bench interface using a thread-safe queue.
    MyConcurrentArena
    This class is meant to represent the concurrent arena for robot battles.
    MyRepairBay
     
    MyRepairLine
    MyRepairLine is an implementation of the RepairLine interface using a thread-safe queue.
    RepairBay
    A simple class to represent a repair bay.
    RepairLine
    Interface for a RepairLine.
    Robot
    Interface defining the main methods for a generic Robot.
    RobotArena
    An abstract implementation of a generic robot arena.
    RobotPart
    Interface defining the main methods for a generic Robot part, i.e., the ones to manage its energy.
    Rotor
    A concrete implementation of a RobotPart; more specifically a Motor part (a Rotor).
    SampleArena
    An example of implementation of a RobotArena.
    SampleBench
    An example of implementation of a Bench.
    SampleRepairLine
    An example of implementation of a RepairLine.
    Sensor
    Interface defining the main method for a generic Sensor part, i.e., managing the defence coefficient.
    SimulationParameters
    This class is provided for your convenience to store the main project parameters all in one place.
    Torso
    A concrete implementation of a RobotPart; more specifically a Frame.
    Wheel
    A concrete implementation of a RobotPart; more specifically a Motor part (a Wheel).
    WheeledRobot
    A concrete implementation of a Robot.
